solution_line_template: Susan needs to make {num_guests}/{servings_per_batch}=<<{num_guests}/{servings_per_batch}={num_batches}>>{num_batches} batches of the recipe.
She will also need {salt_teaspoons_per_batch}*{num_batches}=<<{salt_teaspoons_per_batch}*{num_batches}={total_teaspoons_salt}>>{total_teaspoons_salt} teaspoons of salt.
Thus she will have to buy {total_teaspoons_salt}/{teaspoons_per_container} =<<{total_teaspoons_salt}/{teaspoons_per_container}={num_salt_containers}>>{num_salt_containers} containers of salt.
Therefore, she will spend {total_potatoes}*${potato_cost}=${total_potato_cost} on potatoes and {num_salt_containers}*${salt_container_cost}=${total_salt_cost} on salt.
Thus, she will spend ${total_potato_cost} + ${total_salt_cost} = $<<{total_potato_cost}+{total_salt_cost}={total_food_cost}>>{total_food_cost} on food.
